column11: Review Text

Visiting this stunning church was a truly uplifting experience. The architectural beauty with its unique structure plays with light in the most enchanting way. Every detail seems to whisper the stories of devotion and artistry that have stood the test of time. The atmosphere inside is serene, offering a sanctuary of peace and reflection. Whether you're drawn to its spiritual significance or simply marvel at its design, the church radiates a quiet elegance that leaves a lasting impression. Don't miss exploring the grounds or any unique features. This magnificent church is more than just a place of worship—it's a treasure for the soul and a feast for the eyes.

St. Anne's Church is a blend of local and European culture and a place which is worth to visit. The church is located not too far from Indian ocean from one end and the Puttalam lagoon from the other end. Catholics believe the church has magical ability to make their wishes in to true.
This is a popular church in Srilanka. The church services are crowded. The church complex is big and beautiful. Srilankans from all over the island come here on pilgrimage.
A must visit place of worshiop near Kalpitiya. It is situated few kilometers off from Colombo - Puttlam road. You can visit the place anytime.

This is one of the popular churches in Sri Lanka. This i believed to be miraculous . Worshippers from all parts of the country visit this church . The holy mass on Sunday is at 11 a.m the morning mass not sure of the time. This church ia surrounded by many trees. Yet is very hot. Thereare places for pilgrims to stay over night. There are no much places to buy food during normal days (except feast) so suggest traveller to be prepared

Simple church by the sea attracts many pilgrims who flock there for miracles/divine favors. Wish they had better facilities for pilgrims who travel a long distance to get there. (eg; washrooms with attendants to make sure they are always clean. Recommend they charge a fee).

I have been to this Church sometime back during the feast season. A very holy place and was very crowded at that time with lots of devotees. Very close to the beach and on the way to Kalpitiya  town.  This town is very famous for seasonal whale watching and dolphin watching.

column8: Oldest Chatholic Church in Sri Lanka - a must go place
column11: This Catholic shrine open to none Catholics as well is situated on the beach approximately 5km off main Kalpitiya Puttalam Road. Nicely maintained with lot of trees and open spaces and gardens. Can be very crowded on holidays, poya and and weekends as it is attracting over 1000 visitors per day.
This is a very popular church not only here but whole of Srilanka. Christians come here from all over Srilanka on pilgrimage .This is pretty church inside and outside. This church is well maintained.

column8: Miracle church with lots of blessings
column11: We went a pilgrimage to the church with our family it’s a wonderful place with many prayers and a part time blessing with a bath in the sea. Also went to forest church st. Anthony’s. Lovely church rooms and houses with all the facilities for a pilgrimage.
This is a religious place and please behave well here .use relevant dress codes and respect the place religious things .Be quite also.One of the best places to be

This is a church that is dedicated to Mother of Mother Mary. During last week of the year this place is calm and quite. With few people visiting the place. Take the Talawila Road to reach this place even though it is little bit far away from the other road Jubile Mawatha which is very difficult to travel. Holy mass is at morning 0730hrs and 1130hrs on weekends and holidays. There are very little hotels around this place so if you are comming to visit it is advisable to bring your own food.

One of the most blessed churches in sri lanka and the only church i have faith in! I am not much of a religious person at any point in my life, but this is one of the very few religious places I honestly feels something different and peaceful. This is actually my 4th time at St. Anne's. I was first introduced to this church when i was just 14yrs old by my father. Ever since then, i always felt some unspoken connection with this place. This church believed to have it's own set of miracles and not just catholics but all christian community and non-christians do believe in this blessed church and it's miracles. This is definitely one of the religious grounds a person MUST visit, when they come to sri lanka. In my personal opinion, next to church of Mother of Madu & colombo kochchikade church, this is the next most blessed church in sri lanka.

This is one of the oldest churches in Sri Lanka and attracted by catholic as well as non catholic devotees. Annual festival held on August. We visited there during the night following enjoying the sun set at Thalawila beach. History goes back to 17th century. Sun set was superb from the beach adjacent to the church. Annual festival season comes on August and if you are not comfortable with crowd please avoid that time.
A must visit place to all Catholics. Even non Catholics are welcome. Religious place. Great Church near the beach. A must go place if you are in Sri Lanka

Talavila St.Annes church is one of the most religious ancient churches in Sri Lanka similar Madu church. No matter what religion you are it is advised a visit is a must. Thousands of religious people flock to this church annually, specially in the months of July and August. I presume the annual feast is in the month of July. There are many places which provide accomadation and plenty of area for camping with in a beautiful lush garden. It is very close to the beach and a shrine never to be missed.
Beautiful church facing the sea. this is situated in thalavilla village few kilometers before kalpitiya.
A great experience visiting this place after many years. The Blessed Sacrament chapel should be visited. Sunday masses are at 7.00 a.m. and 11.30  a.m.

This is supposed to be the oldest Catholic church in Sri Lanka. Set close to the beach in the middle of an amazing garden full of great old (and not so old trees) every step towards the church makes one feel spiritual. The stations of the cross, which seem to be a recent addition, are depicted along one paved pathway. The church itself is simple and devoid of unnecessary ornamentation. Unfortunately cheap tinsel put up fro Christmas ruined the atmosphere. there was even a "merry Christmas' sticker on the glass of the inner shrine! I felt very sad that someone thought that decorating with cheap tinsel etc was a good idea!

I had the opportunity to visit St. Anne's church. No matter what religion you follow, St. Anne’s Church in Talawila is one of the most ancient and wonderful of all Christian shrines in Sri Lanka. According to google and locals, this church was Founded in the epicenter of tradition and holiness, thousands of pilgrims flock during the Christmas season, in March and August to this amazing place of solitude and solace. Close to Kalpitiya, the St.Anne’s Church is easy to access with the roads in good condition and offering some stunning views of the Talawila Beach in peace.

From its humble beginnings in the 17th century (or 18th century, depending on which account about its origin you choose to believe), this shrine has grown into one of Sri Lanka's most important place of catholic worship and pilgrimage. However, the complex and its tranquil, leafy surroundings will appeal to people of all faiths. It is easily accessible by road and is a must-visit item if you happen to be in the Puttalam-Kalpitiya area. There were hardly any visitors when we visited, it being outside the annual 'feast' period.
This is a one of the most visited place by Catholics in Sri lanka Located nest to lovely beach and very nice place to visit. During March and August very crowded
one of the most spiritual and blessed church in sri lanka, just 10 munits drive from Kalpitiya road.

Church feast held during March and August. Church is linked with miracles though I do not have personal experience of any from here. Much developed from the 1970s when I first visited the church. Very quiet and calm away from festival period. Basic accommodation available in area.

Spent a pleasant hour or so exploring the grounds and the church.  The grounds contain the stations of the cross and many well established native trees of agricultural significance.  The church is very open and airy with exposed wooden roof for the ceiling.  Quite interesting main chapel and small ones - worth a visit as part of a day's excursion around the peninsular and down to Chilaw.  Unless you have an avid interest in 19th churches it isn't a must see.  Judging from the very basic accommodation which is in abundance it must be heaving when a pilgrimage is on - there are of course numerous donkeys to be seen as they are endemic in the region.
This is shine of St. Anne's. It has a long history and most of the Sri Lankan Catholics visit there to worship.
Holy mass is celebrated at 7 a.m. and 11 a.m. in Sinhala on Sunday. A 'must visit' if you are a Catholic

When I was in SriLanka every year we visited to this church for the August feast. Enormous crowd flocking that time, most of them stay overnight, some stay for a week or more. Every one attend the feast mass held in front of the church. Lots of venders selling various things, families doing shopping, kids playing all around, it's really fantastic atmosphere there! We enjoyed that time. Recently I visited again, nothing changed. Crowd, venders, festival mood, night parties, every thing. But after living several years in Europe, travel around the globe, now I feel how the people stay around this area without adequate sanitation facilities, families live several days with kids in the scorching heat. Church charging large amounts from the vendors. (in 1997 from the soft drink companies - Coke, Pepsi, Elephant house - to put stalls around the church, charged Rs 150,000 each by the church authorities, I personally know this because that  time I am the Pepsi agent for that area, I hand over the money). I can imagine how much income church got now. If they spend this money to build fundamental hygienic facilities to the people, that is the great offering to God!

On the narrow tongue of land, known as the Kalpitiya peninsula, lying between the Puttalam lake and the mighty Indian Ocean, nestles the cosy little Talawila, where the famous sanctuary of St. Anne stands. The country around the shrine is a waste of bleak sand, dotted over with copses of low growth and tall palmyrahs, which with their erect, sturdy trunks terminating in a tuft of broad fan shaped leaves, stand challenging the drought and the monsoon blasts. Around the church, however, there is a fair acreage of full-grown coconut palms, like an oasis in a desert, to gladden the pilgrim. Nature has no charms to offer here in spite of the deep blue sea, which is hardly one hundred meters from the church, the climate is hot and enervating. But, year after year, for the last fifteen decades and more, vast crowds of devout pilgrims, drawn from every strata of life and from every corner of the island, have flocked hither. No human power drew them there; no worldly gain nor love of pleasure or profit or fame brought them there. An old fashioned church and in it a rough image of a Saint, who had loved and died even before the birth of Christianity, these have been the attractions. They have come animated by a sense of an unseen, yet real, power; they have come to worship good and honour His saint, to invoke Divine assistance and offer thanks for favours received.  - kataragama.org

Enjoyed a lovely stay at this house on the lagoon. Relaxing but plenty of exciting activities to do such as whale/ dolphin watching- fabulous !  Never had such fresh and delicious or such enormous juicy  crabs, prawns and lobsters. Comfy bed, good shower and friendly helpful staff. Would like to stay again should I visit Sri Lanka again

This is a much venerated place for Catholics. Beautifully located by the side of a beautiful beach. We went on a pilgrimage and once the religious obligations were completed rest of our journey converted to a pleasure trip. So many nice places to visit. Especially Kalpitiya.

Talawila church located nice place. The road runs palavi to kalpitiya, 16 mils post be the palakudawa junction. From that place there are planty of tuck tucks.200 rupees resionable. Bus have. 9.45 am and 3.30 pm for mails carry to post office to talawila. Houses are avelable. Ask church admin office.
